numbered_ace_sentences: 1. It seems that a richer applicant is more likely to be admitted than a poorer applicant.
2. It seems that an applicant from a richer family is more likely to be admitted than an applicant from a poorer family.
3. A legacy applicant is much more likely to be accepted than a non-legacy applicant.
4. This situation puts middle-income applicants at a severe disadvantage.
5. This situation puts lower-income applicants at a severe disadvantage.
6. This situation raises an equity problem.
7. This situation raises an ethical problem.
8. This situation raises a discrimination problem.
9. I wonder how elite universities can avoid these problems.
10. Universities are not allowed to take bribes.
11. I wonder why this situation is allowed.
12. I will apply to a university soon.
13. Some colleges may discriminate based on income level.
14. This knowledge may help me narrow down the colleges.
15. I want to attend a college that I feel comfortable with.
16. The title is: Elites only: How some applicants' financial or social situations may affect their likelihood of admission.
